stories.title: God of War on PC delivers nearly everything we’d hoped for

stories.text:
I'm currently an eng manager at a pretty mature startup that's trying to transition into a big-tech. I've been an eng manager at a FAANG and transitioned from being a Sr Individual Contributor to an eng manager with about 9 years of experience in total.

In the last year or so, I've lost the excitement I used to feel in the software industry and was hoping that a company change might reset a few things but it did not. I am at a crossroads wherein I want to try out a different career path that leverages my experience but is different from my current role (I don't know which one yet). In the long-term I want to transition into a role in Sports analytics.. What are my potential options in terms of a career switch?
stories.title: Ask HN: Career Paths for an Eng Manager

stories.text:
What tool do you use or recommend when drafting technical blog posts or books?

I've found that editors tend to do one thing or the other very well: they're either really good editors for rich text and multimedia or really good editors for code.

What tools balance the best of both worlds?
stories.title: Ask HN: Best Tools for Technical Writing?
